sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In the hotly anticipated election, President Erdogan of Turkey surprised pollsters everywhere and narrowly fell short of a first-round victory in Turkey's presidential race.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Although topping the polls, the incumbent was unable to secure the 50% plus one votes needed to be directly re-elected for another five years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The president who has been in power for 20 years is said to be facing his biggest election battle to date.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The polls said that this man, the centrist Kamal Kiric Darullu, had the best chance of beating him and even exceeding 50% of the vote in the first round.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: However, the provisional tally says he was four to five points behind.

sentences.sentence: Both camps will turn to the far-right candidate Sinan Ohan, who, with 5% of the tally, will likely be the kingmaker in the second round. A recognition of Volodymyr Zelensky's Europeanism.

sentences.sentence: This Sunday the Ukrainian president received in Germany the Charles the Great Award for European Values, an award that he thanked on behalf of his people.

sentences.sentence: His army is about to launch a counter-offensive against the Russian army and wants to forge a coalition to supply it with aircraft to deal with the invader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Zelenskyy then travelled to Paris, where urgent military aid and assistance are top of the agenda with French President Emmanuel Macron. The Ukrainian troops' counteroffensive is delayed indefinitely.
